</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006, revenues by
    region for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 were
    reclassified to conform to the current period presentation of
    revenues in the Americas, Europe, Middle East, Africa (EMEA),
    and Asia Pacific. In our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2005 the geographic identification of WinZip Internet sales was
    based on the location of the WinZip server rather than the
    location of the customer. In the second quarter of our fiscal
    year ended November&#160;30, 2006, we reclassified WinZip
    internet sales by location of the customer in order to be
    consistent with the rest of the organization. As a result there
    was a reclassification of reported revenue in the aggregate
    amount of $5.6&#160;million from the Americas to EMEA and Asia
    Pacific in the aggregate amount of $4.2&#160;million and
    $1.4&#160;million, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Revenues in the Americas increased by 6.1% for our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2006 to $104.4&#160;million compared to
    $98.4&#160;million for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30
    2005. The increase was principally driven by the increased
    revenues associated with our <I>WinZip </I>products which
    increased because of higher new license sales and upgrades
    resulting from increased conversion of trial customers to
    license users through more aggressive in-product messaging.
    <I>CorelDRAW </I>revenues increased significantly because it is
    in the first half of its release cycle; and we added more North
    American OEM partners and bundling initiatives. The revenue
    increase in the Americas was offset by lower <I>WordPerfect
    </I>revenues due to lower PC shipments by our key OEM partners,
    and in particular Dell, and a decrease in revenues from our
    corporate and government install base.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    EMEA revenues increased 10.0% to $58.3&#160;million for our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006, compared to
    $53.0&#160;million for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2005. EMEA revenues have increased in this period due to new
    licensing agreements and the improved performance of our OEM
    partnerships with Markement, as well as the launch of new
    language versions and localized
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-stores.</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Asia Pacific revenues increased by 14.4% to $14.5&#160;million
    for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006 as compared to
    $12.7&#160;million for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2005. The increased revenue in this geographic segment, as
    compared to the Americas and EMEA, is due primarily to further
    investment in our marketing and sales force in Japan, and the
    release of <I>CorelDraw X3 </I>and <I>WinZip.</I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Cost
    of Revenues</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Cost of Product Revenues.</I>&#160;&#160;Cost of product
    revenues increased 15.6% to $21.3&#160;million in our fiscal
    year ended November&#160;30, 2006 from $18.5&#160;million in our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005. As a percentage of
    product revenues, cost of product revenues increased to 13.6% in
    our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006 from 12.4% in our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005. The increase in the
    period is largely attributable to a change in our distribution
    channel and product mix, as well as increased royalties due to a
    change in the revenue mix in our OEM distribution channels.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Cost of Maintenance and Services
    Revenues.</I>&#160;&#160;Cost of maintenance and services
    revenues decreased 1.0% to $1.1&#160;million in our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2006 from $1.2&#160;million in our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005. As a percentage of
    maintenance and services revenues, cost of maintenance and
    services revenues decreased to 5.7% in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2006 from 7.3% in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005 as there were limited incremental costs
    to provide the additional revenue generated in the current year.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    43
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Amortization of Intangible
    Assets.</I>&#160;&#160;Amortization of intangible assets
    decreased 45% to $14.4&#160;million in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2006 from $26.1&#160;million in our fiscal
    year ended November&#160;30, 2005 as the technology valued in
    connection with our acquisition by Vector Capital and our
    application of push-down accounting, became fully amortized at
    the beginning of our fiscal year ended November 30, 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Operating
    Expenses</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Sales and Marketing.</I>&#160;&#160;Sales and marketing
    expenses increased 1.5% to $54.9&#160;million in our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2006 from $54.0&#160;million in our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005. As a percentage of
    total revenues, sales and marketing expenses decreased to 31.0%
    in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006 from 33.0% in
    our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005. The overall
    increase for the year is primarily related to marketing efforts
    to support our most recent releases of <I>WordPerfect </I>and
    <I>CorelDRAW Graphics Suite </I>in the first half of our fiscal
    year ended November&#160;30, 2006. In relation to revenues,
    sales and marketing has decreased due to a reduction in
    marketing and development fund related activities as well as a
    savings realized from the termination of a naming rights
    agreement on a sports and entertainment venue.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Research and Development.</I>&#160;&#160;Research and
    development expenses increased 10.0% to $25.9&#160;million in
    our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006 from
    $23.5&#160;million in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2005. As a percentage of total revenues, research and
    development expenses increased to 14.6% in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2006 from 14.3% in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005. The increase in expenses is a direct
    result of higher salaries and benefits and localization costs
    related to our products targeted for emerging markets.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>General and Administrative.</I>&#160;&#160;General and
    administrative expenses increased 22.3% to $24.3&#160;million in
    our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006 from
    $19.9&#160;million in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2005. As a percentage of total revenues, general and
    administrative expenses increased to 13.7% in our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2006 from 12.1% during our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2005. The increase is attributable
    largely to costs associated with becoming a public company, as
    well as an increase of $1.2&#160;million in stock based
    compensation for general and administrative employees.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Other Operating Expense.</I>&#160;&#160;Other operating
    expense in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 includes
    $2.2&#160;million related to the termination of an obligation
    for naming rights on a sporting and entertainment venue, and
    $883,000 of fees associated with corporate and tax planning for
    WinZip. Other operating expenses in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2006 include business integration costs of
    $358,000 relating to the acquisition of InterVideo. This
    includes travel costs and other incremental costs for Corel
    employees who worked on the acquisition.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Restructuring.</I>&#160;&#160;Restructuring expense decreased
    by 2.9% to $810,000 for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2006 as compared to $834,000 for our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005. For our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005, restructuring charges consist of
    severance and related expenses for terminated employees. The
    majority of the restructuring charges totaling $834,000 in our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 relate to the
    integration of Jasc. For our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2006, restructuring costs of $810,000 represent charges for the
    elimination of redundant positions and also the severance costs
    related to the realignment of our sales and marketing force in
    the Americas and our research and development team. There are no
    future service obligations due from any of our terminated
    employees, and we do not expect any future restructuring
    expenses to occur as a result of these realignments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Non-Operating
    (Income) Expense</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Loss on Debt Retirement.</I>&#160;&#160;We incurred a loss on
    debt retirement of $8.3&#160;million relating to the write-off
    of deferred financing costs for our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2006 as a result of our refinancing
    $130.0&#160;million of credit facilities prior to maturity, as
    part of our initial public offering on May&#160;2, 2006. The
    $3.9&#160;million loss on retirement of debt in our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2005 consisted of financing fees of
    $1.9&#160;million and an early repayment fee of
    $2.0&#160;million incurred on the termination of the credit
    facility with Wells Fargo Foothill (&#147;WFF&#148;).
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    44
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Interest (Income) Expense, Net.</I>&#160;&#160;Net interest
    expense decreased to $11.3&#160;million in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2006 from $12.6&#160;million in our fiscal
    year ended November&#160;30, 2005. The decrease is primarily
    attributable to the refinancing that occurred in May 2006 where
    we raised $69.1&#160;million of net proceeds from our initial
    public offering, entered into a $90.0&#160;million senior credit
    facility, and repaid $130.0&#160;million of our existing credit
    facilities. The net result was $50.0&#160;million less debt at a
    lower interest rate. As a result, interest expense has decreased
    significantly since May 2006. For our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2006 this was offset by the higher level of
    debt facilities until the time of our initial public offering in
    May 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Amortization of Deferred Financing Fees.</I>&#160;&#160;The
    amortization of deferred financing fees decreased to
    $1.2&#160;million for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2006 as compared to $1.8&#160;million for our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005 as a direct result of the lower financing
    fees incurred under the senior credit facility entered into
    during our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006, as compared
    to those incurred with the Credit Suisse First Boston
    (&#147;CSFB&#148;) facility entered into during our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2005. Financing fees incurred in our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 have been reduced to
    zero as they were expensed and recorded as a loss on debt
    retirement in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Other Non-Operating (Income) Expense.</I>&#160;&#160;Other
    non-operating (income) expense consists primarily of foreign
    exchange gains and losses and unrealized gains and losses on
    forward exchange contracts. There was net income of $565,000 in
    our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006 compared to a net
    expense of $1.2&#160;million in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005. We had non-operating income as opposed
    to non-operating expenses in the prior year comparable period
    due to the significant strengthening of foreign currencies
    against the U.S.&#160;dollar, in particular the Euro and the
    British Pound. This was partially offset by the less significant
    strengthening of the Canadian dollar against the
    U.S.&#160;dollar, which is the currency in which we incur most
    of our expenses.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Income Tax Expense.</I>&#160;&#160;Income tax expense of
    $4.7&#160;million for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2006 consisted of current tax expense of $3.4&#160;million and
    deferred tax expense of $1.3&#160;million compared to a tax
    expense of $6.3&#160;million for our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005 that included current tax expense of
    $5.5&#160;million and a deferred tax expense of $830,000.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Current taxes in both periods include foreign withholding taxes
    plus taxes incurred by our foreign subsidiaries. Deferred tax
    expense in both periods related to the tax benefits realized in
    Canada from the use of tax loss carryforwards, existing prior to
    our acquisition by Vector Capital, in post-acquisition periods,
    less deferred tax credits relating to WinZip operations in 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Our effective tax rate for 2006 was 33.5%, which differs from
    the statutory rate of 36.1% due mostly to a reduction for
    profits which are subjected to lower foreign tax rates. This is
    offset by increases resulting from non deductible expenses and
    foreign withholding taxes which were not creditable in Canada.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    We anticipate an effective tax rate going forward of between 10%
    and 20%. The lower rate as compared to the fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2006, is due to strategic business plans which
    will have profits realized in foreign jurisdictions which have
    tax rates significantly lower than Canada.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Comparison
    of Years Ended November&#160;30, 2005 and November&#160;30,
    2004</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The comparative financial information presented below for our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 is presented on a
    combined basis to include the financial information of WinZip
    from January&#160;18, 2005 to November&#160;30, 2005, which
    reflects the period that WinZip and we were under common control
    by Vector Capital. WinZip accounted for the acquisition by
    Vector Capital by applying push-down accounting. As a result,
    WinZip reduced the amount of its deferred revenue to represent
    the fair value of the associated liability that existed at the
    acquisition date. This resulted in a $66.2&#160;million decrease
    in the liabilities associated with its deferred revenues.
    Approximately $19.8&#160;million of the reduction in deferred
    revenues would have been recognized as revenue in our fiscal
    year ended November&#160;30, 2005. Accordingly, the consolidated
    financial information for our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005 presented below is not directly
    comparable to the consolidated financial information presented
    for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2004. In addition,
    the consolidated financial information presented below includes
    the financial results of the Jasc business since October 2004.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    45
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

</DIV>

<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (1) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Percentage reflects percentage of related revenues.</TD>

    <TD valign="bottom">
    Not Meaningful</TD>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Revenues</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Product revenues increased by 51.8% to $148.3&#160;million in
    our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 from
    $97.7&#160;million in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2004. Growth in our product revenues was a result of our
    inclusion of WinZip revenues beginning in January 2005 and our
    acquisition of Jasc in October 2004, which contributed
    $18.9&#160;million and $36.4&#160;million to product revenues
    for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005, respectively.
    Revenues from our existing products declined $4.7&#160;million
    on a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">year-over-year</FONT>
    basis as several of our products were in the latter half of
    their release cycles.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    46
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Maintenance and services revenues increased by 12.7% to
    $15.7&#160;million in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2005 from $14.0&#160;million in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2004. Our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2005 had a $2.1&#160;million increase in maintenance and
    services revenue from renewals of maintenance contracts, the
    revenues from which were not previously recognized due to the
    application of push-down accounting. An additional $497,000 of
    maintenance and services revenues resulted from the
    implementation of a maintenance program for our <I>WinZip
    </I>product in the latter half of our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005. These increases were partially offset by
    a $900,000 decline in maintenance revenues due to a number of
    government customers not renewing their maintenance contracts.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Total
    Revenues by Product Group</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Productivity revenues increased by 35.8% to $67.6&#160;million
    in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 from
    $49.8&#160;million in 2004. The inclusion of WinZip contributed
    $19.4&#160;million to productivity revenues in our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2005. This increase was partially offset
    by a decline in our <I>WordPerfect </I>products as they reached
    the end of their release cycles.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Graphics and digital imaging revenues increased 56.0% to
    $96.4&#160;million in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2005 from $61.9&#160;million in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2004. Revenues from our core graphics and
    digital imaging products, <I>CorelDRAW Graphics Suite, Corel
    Painter,</I> and <I>Corel DESIGNER Technical Suite</I>, remained
    relatively consistent from 2004 to 2005 at $52.8 million. Sales
    of <I>Corel Paint Shop Pro</I> and <I>Corel Photo Album</I>,
    which were acquired in the Jasc acquisition in late October
    2004, contributed approximately $40.9 million and $4.5 million
    to graphics and digital imaging revenues in our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2005 and our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2004, respectively. On a pro forma basis for
    all of our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2004, including
    the periods before and after our acquisition of Jasc, revenues
    for <I>Corel Paint Shop Pro</I> and <I>Corel Photo Album</I>
    totaled $35.3 million. In addition, there was a $1.8 million
    decline in other
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">non-core</FONT>
    product lines that are no longer supported by additional
    research and development investments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Total
    Revenues by Region</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">

</TD>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006, segmented
    revenues for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 were
    reclassified to conform to the current period presentation of
    revenues in the Americas, Europe, Middle East, Africa and
    Asia-Pacific. In our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005
    the geographic identification of <I>WinZip </I>Internet sales
    was based on the location of our server rather then the location
    of the customer. In the second quarter of our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2006, we reclassified <I>WinZip </I>Internet
    sales by location of the customer in order to be consistent with
    the rest of the organization. As a result there was a
    reclassification of reported revenue in the aggregate amount of
    $5.6&#160;million from the Americas to EMEA and Asia Pacific in
    the aggregate amounts of $4.2&#160;million and
    $1.4&#160;million, respectively.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    47
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The addition of <I>Corel Paint Shop Pro </I>and <I>Corel Photo
    Album </I>to our product line resulted in increased revenues of
    $21.5&#160;million, $11.5&#160;million and $3.4&#160;million in
    the Americas, EMEA and Asia Pacific, respectively, in our fiscal
    year ended November&#160;30, 2005 compared to our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2004. The inclusion of <I>WinZip </I>in
    our results increased revenues by $12.9&#160;million,
    $5.0&#160;million and $1.5&#160;million in the Americas, EMEA
    and Asia Pacific, respectively, in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005 compared to our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2004.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Revenues from our existing products and services in the Americas
    declined overall by $3.2&#160;million in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005 over our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2004 as a few of our products were in the
    second half of their release cycle. This overall decline was net
    of a $1.0&#160;million increase in <I>Corel Painter </I>revenue
    due to the release of <I>Corel Painter 9 </I>in the fourth
    quarter of our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2004 and a
    $2.1&#160;million increase in <I>WordPerfect </I>maintenance
    revenue contracts, the revenues from which were not previously
    recognized due to the application of push-down accounting.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    EMEA revenues for our existing products and services decreased
    overall by $2.3&#160;million due to a decline in the retail
    sales of <I>CorelDRAW</I>, which was in the second half of its
    release cycle. This decline was net of a $698,000 increase in
    <I>Corel DESIGNER 12 </I>revenues and a $587,000 increase in
    <I>Corel Painter</I> revenues due to the two products being in
    earlier stage of their release cycles.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Excluding the addition of <I>Corel Paint Shop Pro </I>and
    <I>Corel Photo Album</I>, Asia Pacific revenues increased by
    $1.7&#160;million due to the opening of our office in Japan and
    renewed focus on the Japanese market.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Cost
    of Revenues</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Cost of Product Revenues.</I>&#160;&#160;Cost of product
    revenues increased 29.9% to $18.5&#160;million in our fiscal
    year ended November&#160;30, 2005 from $14.2&#160;million in our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2004. As a percentage of
    product revenues, cost of product revenues decreased to 12.4% in
    our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 from 14.5% in our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2004. The decrease as a
    percentage of product revenues was primarily attributable to an
    increased percentage of sales made via electronic downloads, as
    opposed to sales of packaged products in physical form. This
    change in our distribution mix is largely due to the inclusion
    of WinZip, which primarily distributes product via electronic
    downloads.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Cost of Maintenance and Services
    Revenues.</I>&#160;&#160;Cost of maintenance and services
    revenues increased 6.4% to $1.2&#160;million in our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2005 from $1.1&#160;million in our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2004. As a percentage of
    maintenance and services revenues, cost of maintenance and
    services revenues decreased to 7.3% in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005 from 7.8% in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2004. This decrease resulted from the increase
    in maintenance and services revenues with a smaller increase in
    associated costs, which are primarily fixed costs.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Amortization of Intangible
    Assets.</I>&#160;&#160;Amortization of intangible assets
    increased 58.0% to $26.1&#160;million in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005 from $16.5&#160;million in our fiscal
    year ended November&#160;30, 2004 due to $5.8&#160;million and
    $3.6&#160;million of amortization of technology and other
    intangible assets associated with the acquisition of Jasc and
    WinZip, respectively. The asset revaluation amounts from the
    application of push-down accounting from our acquisition by
    Vector Capital in 2003 will be fully amortized by the end of the
    first quarter of our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Operating
    Expenses</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Sales and Marketing.</I>&#160;&#160;Sales and marketing
    expenses increased 40.4% to $54.0&#160;million in our fiscal
    year ended November&#160;30, 2005 from $38.5&#160;million in our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2004. As a percentage of
    total revenues, sales and marketing expenses decreased to 33.0%
    in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 from 34.5% in
    our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2004. Increases to sales
    and marketing expenses included $5.6&#160;million and
    $1.6&#160;million related to the acquisition of Jasc and WinZip
    respectively. In addition, salaries and benefits related to the
    expansion of our sales and marketing organization contributed
    $6.9&#160;million of this increase, and stock-based expenses
    contributed over $500,000 of this increase.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    48
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Research and Development.</I>&#160;&#160;Research and
    development expenses increased 61.8% to $23.5&#160;million in
    our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 from
    $14.6&#160;million in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2004. As a percentage of total revenues, research and
    development expenses increased to 14.3% in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005 from 13.0% in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2004. The addition of Jasc and the inclusion
    of WinZip research and development teams accounted for
    $5.7&#160;million and $2.0&#160;million of the increase,
    respectively. The increase as a percentage of revenue is a
    result of the Jasc product line having relatively higher
    development costs. Development costs for <I>WordPerfect </I>were
    also brought back in-house late in 2004, and added $956,000 of
    costs in the year ended November&#160;30, 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>General and Administrative.</I>&#160;&#160;General and
    administrative expenses increased 33.4% to $19.9&#160;million in
    our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 from
    $14.9&#160;million in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2004. As a percentage of total revenues, general and
    administrative expenses decreased to 12.1% in our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2005 from 13.3% during our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2004. The absolute dollar increase in
    general and administrative expenses resulted from the
    acquisition of Jasc and WinZip operations, which contributed
    $1.7&#160;million and $2.3&#160;million, respectively. In our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 we also incurred over
    $800,000 in additional stock-based expenses due to our executive
    hirings and $292,000 of professional fees associated with
    corporate governance and planning.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Other Operating Expense.</I>&#160;&#160;Other operating
    expense in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 includes
    $2.2&#160;million related to the termination of an obligation
    for naming rights on a sporting and entertainment venue, and
    $883,000 of fees associated with corporate and tax planning for
    WinZip.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Restructuring.</I>&#160;&#160;Restructuring consists of
    severance and related expenses for terminated employees. The
    majority of the restructuring charges totaling $834,000 in our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 relate to the
    integration of Jasc. There are no future service obligations due
    from any of our terminated employees, and we do not expect any
    future restructuring expenses to occur as a result of the Jasc
    integration.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The restructuring charges in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2004 reflect the restructuring of our
    operations after the acquisition of us by Vector Capital. These
    amounts include severance for certain senior executives. All
    amounts associated with this restructuring plan were paid by
    November&#160;30, 2004. There are no further service obligations
    due from any of our terminated employees, and we do not expect
    any future expenses associated with this restructuring.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Non-Operating
    (Income) Expense</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Loss on Debt Retirement.</I>&#160;&#160;The $3.9&#160;million
    loss on retirement of debt in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005 consisted of financing fees of
    $1.9&#160;million, and an early repayment fee of
    $2.0&#160;million incurred on the termination of the credit
    facility with WFF. The remaining unamortized portion of the
    fees, along with the early repayment charge were written-off
    when the WFF facility was repaid in full in February 2005 and a
    new debt facility was arranged with CSFB.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Interest (Income) Expense, Net.</I>&#160;&#160;Net interest
    expense increased to $12.6&#160;million in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005 from $1.2&#160;million in our fiscal year
    ended 2004. During our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005,
    our borrowings averaged $136.0&#160;million, while in our fiscal
    year ended November&#160;30, 2004 our borrowings averaged
    $31.3&#160;million. These borrowings were used primarily to fund
    distributions to our shareholders and the acquisition of Jasc.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Amortization of Deferred Financing Fees.</I>&#160;&#160;In
    our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005, we entered into a
    new debt facility with CSFB increasing our total debt to
    $130.0&#160;million. This facility had higher financing fees
    associated with it and consequently amortization of deferred
    financing fees increased from $407,000 to $1.8&#160;million in
    our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Other Non-Operating Expense.</I>&#160;&#160;Other
    non-operating expense consists primarily of foreign exchange
    gains and losses and unrealized gains and losses on forward
    exchange contracts. The expense of $1.2&#160;million in our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 compared to a gain of
    $1.0&#160;million in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2004 is due the decline of the U.S.&#160;dollar compared to the
    Euro and Japanese Yen.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    49
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Income Tax Expense.</I>&#160;&#160;Income tax expense of
    $6.3&#160;million for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2005 consisted of current tax expense of $5.5&#160;million plus
    deferred tax expense of $830,000, compared to a tax expense of
    $7.3&#160;million for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2004 that included current tax expense of $2.1&#160;million plus
    deferred tax expense of $5.2&#160;million. Our income tax
    expense for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005 is net
    of the recovery from the settlement of a tax claim in Europe of
    approximately $500,000 and includes approximately
    $4.1&#160;million of current taxes on WinZip operations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Current taxes in both periods include foreign withholding taxes
    plus taxes incurred by our foreign subsidiaries. Deferred tax
    expense in both periods related to the tax benefits realized in
    Canada from the use of tax loss carryforwards, existing prior to
    our acquisition by Vector Capital, in post-acquisition periods,
    less deferred tax credits relating to WinZip operations in 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">LIQUIDITY
    AND CAPITAL RESOURCES</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of November&#160;30, 2006, our principal sources of liquidity
    include cash and cash equivalents of $51.0&#160;million and
    trade accounts receivable of $18.2&#160;million. As a part of
    our senior credit facility, we also entered into a five-year
    $75.0&#160;million revolving line of credit facility, which was
    unused at November&#160;30, 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    On December&#160;12, 2006, we completed our acquisition of
    InterVideo purchasing all of the outstanding shares of
    InterVideo, for a cash purchase price of approximately
    $198.6&#160;million. The acquisition was financed through a
    combination of our cash reserves, InterVideo&#146;s cash
    reserves and debt financing which included us entering into an
    amendment to our existing credit agreement to increase our
    available term borrowings by $70.0&#160;million. As part of this
    acquisition, we used $19.1&#160;million of our cash reserves and
    used $38.0&#160;million of our revolving line of credit.
    Throughout our current fiscal year, we expect to incur
    significant additional incremental costs from this acquisition,
    such as direct costs related to the acquisition, costs
    associated with restructuring our operations, and debt and
    interest payments associated with the additional term borrowing
    and the use of our revolving line of credit. We expect to
    maintain the level of cash flows from operating activities that
    we have achieved over the last three fiscal years, which will
    fund these additional cash requirements; furthermore, the
    existing InterVideo operations have generated positive cash
    flows for the past three fiscal years, which we expect to
    continue. In addition to our cash flows expected from our
    operating activities, we have cash and cash equivalents, funds
    available from our revolving line of credit, and a letter of
    credit facility that will be sufficient to meet the additional
    cash outlays required by this acquisition.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Based on our current business plan and internal forecasts, we
    believe that the existing cash and cash equivalents, together
    with funds generated from operations and the unused operating
    line of credit facility included under our senior credit
    facility, will be sufficient to meet our working capital and
    operating resource expenditure requirements for the next twelve
    months. Cash from operations could be affected by various risks
    and uncertainties, including, but not limited to, the risks
    detailed in or incorporated by reference in
    Item&#160;1A&#151;&#147;<I>Risk Factors</I>&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Working
    Capital</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Net working capital at November&#160;30, 2006 was
    $31.2&#160;million, an increase of $44.7&#160;million from the
    November&#160;30, 2005 working capital deficit of
    $13.5&#160;million. The increase was largely attributable to
    proceeds generated from our initial public offering, the
    refinancing of our credit facilities, and cash generated from
    our operations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Current assets at November&#160;30, 2006 were
    $73.9&#160;million, an increase of $28.2&#160;million from the
    November&#160;30, 2005&#160;year end balance of
    $45.7&#160;million. The increase was primarily attributable to
    the increase in cash and cash equivalents of $30.3&#160;million.
    Cash and cash equivalents increased due to the initial public
    offering completed during the year as well as continued positive
    cash flow from our operating activities.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Current liabilities at November&#160;30, 2006 were
    $42.8&#160;million, a decrease of $16.4&#160;million from
    November&#160;30, 2005. The decrease primarily resulted from the
    decrease in the current portion of our loans
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    50
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

    payable of $15.5&#160;million as a result of our refinancing in
    May 2006. There has also been a decrease in accounts payable and
    accrued liabilities of $1.9&#160;million.

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Year
    ended November&#160;30, 2006 compared to year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005.</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Cash flow from operations of $36.2&#160;million in our fiscal
    year ended November&#160;30, 2006 was a decrease of
    $4.2&#160;million from our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2005. Cash provided by operating activities for our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2006, was primarily comprised of net
    income, net of non-cash related expenses, the largest being
    amortization of intangible assets and the loss on the retirement
    of debt which are not expected to continue into our fiscal year
    ending November&#160;30, 2007. Working capital uses of cash were
    a decrease in accounts payable and a decrease in income taxes
    payable. Working capital sources of cash were a decrease in
    deferred revenue and a decrease in accounts receivable. There
    were no significant non operating cash receipts included in net
    income in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Cash used in financing activities was $3.9&#160;million in our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006 compared to cash used
    in financing activities of $38.5&#160;million in our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2005. In our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005, there were cash distributions to
    shareholders of $97.3&#160;million as compared to
    $7.5&#160;million in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2006. Furthermore, there was net cash proceeds of
    $69.1&#160;million generated in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2006 from our initial public offering. This
    was offset by our term loan financing which resulted in a use of
    cash of $60.3&#160;million in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2006 as compared to the net proceeds of
    $69.4&#160;million from debt in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Cash flow used in investing activities was $1.9&#160;million in
    our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006 compared to cash
    provided by investing activities of $7.3&#160;million in our
    fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2005. In our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2005, there were redemptions on
    short-term investments of $10.0&#160;million, while there were
    no such proceeds in our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2006. These inflows were offset by cash used to purchase long
    lived assets of $1.9&#160;million in our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2006 and $1.9&#160;million in our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Indebtedness</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    On May&#160;2, 2006, we entered into a $165.0&#160;million
    senior credit facility consisting of a $90.0&#160;million term
    loan with a six-year maturity and a $75.0&#160;million revolving
    line of credit with a five-year term as part of our debt
    restructuring. Proceeds from this refinancing were used to repay
    our existing debt, the CSFB term loan and credit facility, and
    the WinZip debt. As a result, we incurred a loss on debt
    retirement of $8.3&#160;million. On December&#160;12, 2006, this
    facility was amended, as we completed our acquisition of
    InterVideo. The acquisition was partially financed through an
    amendment to the credit facility for an additional
    $70.0&#160;million of term borrowings.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The credit facility agreement required us to make fixed
    quarterly principal repayments of 0.25% of the original
    principal amount on the term loan, or $225,000 from June 2006 to
    December 2006 and $400,000 from January 2007 through to December
    2011, with the balance of the loan due in April 2012. The term
    loan and revolving line of credit bear interest at floating
    rates tied to either the Alternate Base Rate (which equals the
    higher of (i)&#160;the federal funds rate plus 50&#160;basis
    points, and (ii)&#160;the prime rate or the Adjusted LIBOR
    (LIBOR plus 3.25% until December 2006 and LIBOR plus 4.00%
    thereafter). On an annual basis, beginning at the end of
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    51
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    the first quarter of our fiscal year ending November&#160;30,
    2008, we are required to make a cash sweep payment to fund the
    term loan&#146;s principal balance, based on excess cash flow as
    defined in the agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In connection with the senior credit facility, we obtained
    interest rate protection by entering into an interest rate swap
    with our principal lender for $71.5&#160;million. The variable
    rate of interest is based on three-month LIBOR plus 3.25%. The
    fixed rates range from 8.62% to 8.74%.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In addition to the above loans, the facility also provides us
    with a $25.0&#160;million ($10.0&#160;million up to December
    2006)&#160;letter of credit and a $5.0&#160;million Swingline
    commitment. The applicable interest rate on any borrowings is
    based on a leverage ratio pricing grid. As at November&#160;30,
    2006, no balance was outstanding on either the letter of credit
    or the Swingline commitment.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The combined committed debt payments, for both the existing term
    loan of approximately $89.6&#160;million as at December&#160;12,
    2006 and the additional term loan borrowing of
    $70.0&#160;million, based on the interest rates as at
    December&#160;12, 2006 are as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The borrowings under the senior credit facility are
    collateralized by a pledge of all of our assets, including
    subsidiary stock. Under the terms of the credit agreement, we
    are subject to restrictive covenants. The agreement contains
    customary restrictions, such as restrictions on additional
    borrowing, distributions and business acquisitions/divestitures.
    It also contains financial covenants including the following
    requirements:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    a maximum total leverage ratio, which is defined as the ratio of
    total debt to trailing four quarter consolidated Adjusted
    EBITDA, as defined in the credit agreement, to be less than
    specified amounts over the term of the facility, from 3.50:1.00
    to 2.25:1.00; the applicable note for November&#160;30, 2006 was
    3.00:1.00.
</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    a minimum fixed charge coverage ratio, which is defined as the
    ratio of trailing four quarter consolidated Adjusted EBITDA to
    fixed charges, of 2.50 to 1.00 up to December 2006, 2.00 to 1.00
    from January 2006 until November 2010, 2.25 to 1.00 from
    December 2010 to November 2011 and 2.50 to 1.00 thereafter.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of November&#160;30, 2006, we were in compliance with all
    debt covenants. We have included the following reconciliation
    from the cash flow provided by operations to the Adjusted EBITDA
    used in the covenant calculations. Adjusted EBITDA is a non-GAAP
    measure that we use to assist in evaluation of our liquidity and
    is used by our bank lenders to calculate compliance with certain
    financial covenants. Adjusted EBITDA was $55.2&#160;million for
    our fiscal year ended November&#160;30, 2006 compared to
    $49.0&#160;million for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2006. The increase of $6.2&#160;million in this period is due
    mainly to higher revenue, leading to an increase in income from
    operations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    This measure does not have any standardized meaning prescribed
    by GAAP and therefore is unlikely to be comparable to the
    calculation of similar measures used by other companies, and
    should not be viewed as alternatives to measures of financial
    performance or changes in cash flows calculated in accordance
    with GAAP. We consider cash flow from operations to be the
    closest GAAP measure to Adjusted EBITDA. For our
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    52
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

    fiscal years ended November&#160;30, 2006 and 2005, we had cash
    flow from operations of $36.2&#160;million and
    $40.5&#160;million, respectively. The table below reconciles
    Adjusted EBITDA to cash flow from operations:

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Contractual
    Obligations and Commitments</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    We have operating leases for office space and computer
    equipment. In accordance with GAAP, neither the lease
    liabilities nor the underlying assets are carried on the balance
    sheet as the terms of the leases do not meet the thresholds for
    capitalization. Payments on these leases were approximately
    $5.2&#160;million for our fiscal year ended November&#160;30,
    2006, $4.4&#160;million for our fiscal year ended
    November&#160;30, 2005 and $4.1&#160;million for our fiscal year
    ended November&#160;30, 2004.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    We have debt as discussed in the indebtedness section above.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table outlines our contractual commitments over
    the next five years and thereafter at November&#160;30, 2006:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
